title: Drapers investigates: how fashion retail is carbon offsetting - Drapers
summary: Fashion businesses are increasingly using carbon offsetting to reduce their emissions, but concerns have been raised about the effectiveness of these schemes. Some experts argue that carbon offsetting can be a useful tool in the fight against climate change, while others believe that it is a form of greenwashing. Businesses that want to use carbon offsetting should carefully research programmes to ensure that they are having a genuine impact on emissions.

title: Govt to buy up €3 million worth of carbon credits from Slovakia to meet climate targets - TheJournal.ie
summary: The Irish government is purchasing €2.9 million worth of carbon credits from Slovakia to comply with EU 2020 emission targets. The credits are being bought to comply with emission targets within specific sectors of the economy, particularly buildings, transport, agriculture, waste, and some sections of industry. The purchase comes after both EU member states and politicians reached an agreement to reform the bloc’s carbon market.
greenwashing: The article does not describe an instance of greenwashing.

title: Using blockchain to rethink systems and society - Delano.lu
summary: Survcoin is a cryptocurrency that rewards decarbonisation efforts. Food For Future is an agriculture company that uses technology to bring innovative technologies to farmers in developing countries and enable regenerative agriculture practices on a large scale. Nash FintechX is developing a blockchain-based carbon market.

title: 55 Women-Owned Businesses That Give Back & Do Good - Good Good Good
summary: The article provides a directory of the best women-owned businesses that make the world a better place. The businesses identified in the article include those focused on clothing and accessories, home goods, food, health and beauty, lifestyle, pets, and media. The directory provides product details, company information, and charitable endeavors for each women-owned business.
